shapes3d.utils
Interface I_PathGen

public interface I_PathGen

This interface defines the methods need to define a parametric path in 3D.
A class that implements this interface can be used to create PathTube shapes.

Author:
Peter Lager

Method Summary
 float x(float t)
          Method defines the function x = f(t) where t is in the range >=0 and <=1.
 float y(float t)
          Method defines the function y = g(t) where t is in the range >=0 and <=1.
 float z(float t)
          Method defines the function z = h(t) where t is in the range >=0 and <=1.
 

Method Detail

x

float x(float t)
Method defines the function x = f(t) where t is in the range >=0 and <=1. When you implement this method there is no need to constrain the value of t to this range as this is done in the PathTube class.

Parameters:
t - >=0 and <= 1.0
Returns:
the x position

y

float y(float t)
Method defines the function y = g(t) where t is in the range >=0 and <=1. When you implement this method there is no need to constrain the value of t to this range as this is done in the PathTube class.

Parameters:
t - >=0 and <= 1.0
Returns:
the y position

z

float z(float t)
Method defines the function z = h(t) where t is in the range >=0 and <=1. When you implement this method there is no need to constrain the value of t to this range as this is done in the PathTube class.

Parameters:
t - >=0 and <= 1.0
Returns:
the z position
